Datatable.LocalizationPair: Due to a limited understanding of the reproductive mechanisms of the lesser populations that they oversee, breeding programs are less efficient than one would otherwise expect
Due to a limited understanding of the reproductive mechanisms of the lesser populations that they oversee, breeding programs are less efficient than one would otherwise expect

-40% Influence Bubble Radius on Systems
x85% Peaceful Treaty cost on Empire per Peace
x80% Peaceful Treaty cost on Empire per Alliance
Underground Comprehension

The underground caverns of fertile planets are often potential habitable zones that stay unutilized, often for good reason. However, thanks to recent advancement in soil cultivation, the amount of necessary soil needed for full replenishment of cultivation potential has been drastically lowered, indirectly allowing hazardous zones to be settled.
Studies of those Enhanced by Dust

Dust is a powerful substance for those able to wield it. However, those that are able to are in such pitiful numbers that the art, science and perfection of the craft of dust is simply non existent. By making sure that it is studied upon, heroes gain abilities at a marvelous rate
Advanced City Planning

Why are systems developed around luxuries? That, is a question that is consistently asked by those living in the new systems of an empire. Once you go to an established system, one that is already developed, the answer becomes clear. System development is irreversible, and can cause many problems if not handled properly, as seen in the older systems, the luxury standard simply stops to elevate after a while once all it's implications have been found. However, to remedy to this problem one needs to use luxurious luxuries but the cost is simply prohibitive... Up until now. The city planner is able to change the shape or form of raw luxuries, so that from a lower amount of luxuries, more can be done.
Ecosystem Perfection
When a planet reaches it's carrying capacity, it becomes much clearer as to what the population needs to be placed where to maximize efficiency. Productivity on full planets skyrockets.
Perfection of the Perfected

The studies around heroes and dust has been yielding good results. The heroes themselves have benefited tremendously from these studies, and are now regarded as beings of almost unparalled beauty, after the First of course. With beauty comes strength, and with this beauty they have been enhanced. With this strength they shine like a beacon in this galaxy riddled with war. As perception is combined with strength, the abilities of heroes multiplied and due to being the most beautiful, the rewards are ripe for the taking.
Economical Adaptation

Do you remember what I said about knowing every application of a given luxury? Well, forget it, because the Endless-modified super-potato still has many secrets to be revealed! Indeed, recent breakthrough revealed that Endless-modified luxuries had, potentially, endless applications. The latest breakthrough becomes the new trend, researchers have infinite subjects to discuss, industrial applications lack only manpower and even the most diseased piece of food can become delicious.
Horatification
Gene Warriors
Cloning Facilities Enhancement
Vanity Market
Perfected Defense
Arcane Designs Comprehension
Masterwork of the Perfect
Horatification
Gene Warriors
Cloning Facilities Enhancement
Vanity Market
Perfected Defense
By spreading word of the need of the galaxy to be beautified and people rallied to their cause, the hero makes the population zealous.

Using methods known to Horatio heroes, whom have access to advanced cloning technology the hero is able to enhance their troops to perform vastly more efficiently than their non-perfected counterparts.
By reusing the data and waste or leftover products from cloning experiments, the hero is able to boost system productivity based on cloning activity.
Vanity Markets
The Hero takes control of the luxury deposits in the system, artificially increasing their value and increasing demand.
By making the ships be constantly reviewed and upgraded by engineers, alongside using defensive tactics specific to these ships, the defensive capabilities of the ships greatly increases.

The complex design of perfection is always tested, reviewed, but never understood. At least, that's what was thought until recently. As the hero gets one step closer to perfection, the way the ships are designed use novel methods of construcion and enjoy a greater combat power, albeit at a greater industry cost.

Using the complex structures of the ship, and understanding them properly, the hero is always able to squeeze the full amount of defensive power a ship can provide by preventing early destruction due to an unlucky shot.
+2.5% [foodcolored] to [industrycolored][dustColored][scienceColored] per System Level
+5.0% [foodcolored] to [industrycolored][dustColored][scienceColored] per System Level
+2% Influence Radius per Hero Level
+1 Module Multiplier on Hero Ships +5% Maximum Health on Hero Ship per Hero Level +5% Maximum Shield on Hero Ship per Hero Level
Clone Wares Senator Skill
Clone Wares Senator Skill
Hungry Machines

With such vast reserves of raw material, this society has never felt pressed to develop efficient space flight, instead relying on a continuous flow of spare parts and engineering students, the wastefulness of which hasn't caught up to them yet.
+2 [happinesscolored] on Systems per Depleted Planet on Empire
2x Colonization Cap from Overcolonization Techs
2x Undercolonization [fidsi] from Overcolonization Techs
Aurigan Expansion
Seeking a new life beyond the shattered waste of their prior home, the Aurigan Federation has an inherent need to expand within certain limits
-33% System Development cost
Opulent Frontiers

Though seldom a politician's first choice, transparency with the people can grant them the insider knowledge regarding recent luxury deposit discoveries, resulting in enthusiastic exploitation of their riches.
Environmental Optimization
By sharing planetary climate data with each other, local officials can implement improved planetary exploitation techniques pioneered elsewhere in the empire, improving each planet's output.
+25% [FIDS] from Initial Planet Values
Prompt Pioneering
Advances in food packing and preservation facilitates faster networks of food transportation logistics.
Relentless Assault

An AI with access to the records of thousands of battle outcomes is installed on the helm of every military vessel and programmed to guide the crew through post-op procedures. Thus, fleets and their crew can be reorganized and ready for their next assignment with minimal delay.
+1 Action Points on Ships
Arcological Administration

Using advanced city planning algorithms, the system enters a cycle of constantly rising efficiency. The empire can now focus on the refinement of such systems over the administration of redundant territories.
Elections will occur twice as often Raze action will not incur an Approval penalty
+30% Flak Damage vs Squadrons on Fleet
+100% Flak Damage vs Squadrons on Fleet
Dust Catalyzation
Dust Catalyzation
With the knack of how to improve the resolution of deep-field imaging techniques, the Hero can extend the vision range and bombardment targeting precision of their assigned fleet.
Blending knowledge of the weaknesses in weapon systems from around the galaxy--from Lumerian torpedo tech to Craver plasma bombers--the Hero can squeeze extra punch out of any flak defenses.
Harmonious Population
By ensuring facilities are available for every major race in your empire, even an amoeba would be able to work on a lava planet.
+5% Repair after Battle
+10% Repair after Battle
+20% Repair after Battle
+40% Repair after Battle
Research Sanctuaries

Every once and a while, planets with oddities worthy of study are discovered. By dedicating a portion of the planet's surface to preservation, study, and investigation, universities and laboratories are given free reign to uncover the mysteries of the galaxy.
Teamster Refurbishing

Who would have thought that despite having 3D printers that can construct sky-scrapers within minutes that the major hold up would be the supplies. By replacing Teamster networks with robots capable of doing their jobs properly, construction might actually meet the deadlines.
By instilling those under their command with steely resolve and focus while engaging in planetary assault, the Hero is able to train their crew to more efficiently invade.
Adventurer's Thrift
Extensive travel to distant frontiers of the galaxy provides the hero with expertise in making needed repairs while roughing it.
Prevents Enemy retreat in Space Battle
Public Repositories
By replacing long-since derelict warehouses and offices with modernized centers of learning, every citizen is given access to trillions of pieces of media from all around the galaxy.
Exotic Weapon Proficiency
Streamlined Research
Blood Scent
+20% Boarding Pods Damage on Fleet
+40% Boarding Pods Damage on Fleet
Fleet Black Market

By encouraging a controlled black market to develop on board the fleet, the Hero is able to salvage components from every ship destroyed and increase crew motivation to seek out the next lucrative score.
Adaptable Exploitation
Adaptable Exploitation

One too many forays onto backwater planets with extremely basic exploitation methods has given the Hero a rich, even aromatic, understanding of how to get the best out of planets' innate yields. Consolidating this know-how across the Hero's System can substantially improve yields on even the most advanced planets.
+15% [FIDS] from Initial Planet Values
+30% [FIDS] from Initial Planet Values
Legendary Authority
The Hero runs any fleets under their command so tightly, that a single imperfect element is considered a source of major shame. Squadron health and damage is greatly enhanced.
For the eusocial species, the health of the entire superorganism is paramount. As such, the Hero requires shielding to maximize its coverage of the fleet.
Through mastery of the substance, the Hero is able to project part of their personal Dust field into their fleet's EMP and planetary destruction systems, raising effectiveness.
+5% [industryColored] per Colonized Planets with Anomalies on System
Virtual Research
Through direct pursuit of Virtual secrets, the hero is able to make use of their expertise to generate scientific breakthroughs
+5 [happinessColored] per System with a colonized Unique Planet and a Governor on Empire.
+10 [prestigeColored] per System with a colonized Unique Planet and a Governor on Empire.
Surviving Ships automatically repair to full Health after combat
Note: Academy ships cannot be boarded, so they have retreated

Faction Pact

Both empires will receive a separate bonus, determined by the faction the pact is made with. The effects of the pact are listed in the Gameplay Affinity of the faction you are making the pact with. The effects will slowly increment per turn, and will max out in 30 turns [turn] (scaling with game speed).

The effects will slowly increment per turn, and will max out in 30 turns [turn] (scaling with game speed).

The effects will slowly increment per turn, and will max out in 30 turns [turn] (scaling with game speed).

Faction Pact

The effects will slowly increment per turn, and will max out in 30 turns [turn] (scaling with game speed).
Cancel Faction Pact
This is a unilateral declaration to stop a Faction Pact with an other empire. The effects of this protocol will cease immediately, along with its Influence upkeep costs.
Faction Pact Bonuses:
Displays all bonuses gained from all your Faction Pacts made with members of your alliance.
Faction Pact

Both empires will receive a separate bonus, determined by the faction the pact is made with. The effects of the pact are listed in the Gameplay Affinity of the faction you are making the pact with. The effects will slowly increment per turn, and will max out in 30 turns [turn] (scaling with game speed).
Faction Pact
Faction Pact
This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Cravers. Your faction will gain -0.5% Ship [industryColored] Cost on Systems per Turn [turn] (Max: -15%), increase scales with game speed.
Faction Pact
This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the United Empire. Your faction will gain +1% [prestigeColored] on Systems per Turn [turn] (Max: 30%), increase scales with game speed.

This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the United Empire. Your faction will gain +0.5% [prestigeColored] and +0.5% [manpower] Generation on Systems per Turn [turn] (Max: 15% each), increase scales with game speed.

This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the United Empire. Your faction will gain +0.5% [prestigeColored] and +0.5% [scienceColored] on Systems per Turn [turn] (Max: 15% each), increase scales with game speed.
Faction Pact
This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Horatio. Your faction will gain +1.5% [foodColored] on Systems per Turn [turn] (Max: 45%), increase scales with game speed.
Faction Pact
This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Lumeris. Your faction will gain +1% [dustColored] on Systems per Turn [turn] (Max: 30%), increase scales with game speed.
Faction Pact
This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Vodyani. Your faction will gain +1% Hero XP Gain on Empire per Turn [turn] (Max: 30%), increase scales with game speed.
Faction Pact
Faction Pact

This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Unfallen. Your faction will gain +1 [happinessColored] on Systems per Turn [turn] if not Hissho (Max: 30), increase scales with game speed. Your faction will gain +1% [honorColored] Gain per Turn [turn] if Hissho (Max: 30%), increase scales with game speed.
Faction Pact
Faction Pact
This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Hisshos. Your faction will gain +1% [manpower] Generation on Systems per Turn [turn] (Max: 30%), increase scales with game speed.
Faction Pact

This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Umbral Choir. Your faction will gain +1% [processingPower] and +1 [hackingSpeed] per Turn [turn] (Max: 30% and 30 respectively), increase scales with game speed.
Faction Pact
This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Nakalim. Your faction will gain -1% Hero Unlock Threshold on Empire per Turn [turn] (Max: -30%), increase scales with game speed.
What do you think of a faction pact?
kssrrrh-boop! . . . AFFECTIONATE: Agree to a pact.
Shall we sign a holy pact?
What do you say to a faction pact deal?
Would you bind with the Heart in a pact?
Join the Empire in a glorious pact!
Horatio does you the honor of offering a faction pact.
The Communion offers you a faction pact.
The Vaulters are prepared to make a pact.
I offer you this proposition, as emperor of the Hissho nation and disciple of Tonatsi, will you accept a pact of blood?
Creature, the Choir seeks only harmony. We are prepared to make a pact.
As Queen of the Nakalim Lords and leader of a devout people, it is with great esteem I offer you a faction pact.
You think you've got the brains for us!? Come on then, put 'em up!
vzzz--brrrrt--cthok . . . EAGER: The Hive will eat well soon if you speak the truth.
You seem to have mistakenly sent us some very poor diplomats. Surely you wouldn't actually threaten us, hmm?
We could never forget this! Because we haven't laughed so hard in ages.
You're making the Families nervous. The last person who made us nervous hasn't been seen in a while. You get me?
Like storms of hail or dust, your words are best ignored for the excess wind that they are.
Your saber rattling is only the nervous response of those uninitiated in the teachings of the Virtual.
This universe is hostile to us down to its atoms. We are not surprised that you are as well.
While I do not seek war, the interests of my people must come before your petty politics.
You warn of conflict. We sharpen blades.
We hoped you would realize your folly before making your intent public. Unfortunately not.
My personal library alone records more warnings sent to the Nakalim than there are habitable worlds. We remain; they do not.
For an intelligent civilization, you're really testing our patience. And failing.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . ANNOYED: Your species has begun to raise our ire. The Hive has placed you considerably higher on the menu.
I grow impatient with your failures. Unfortunately I cannot punish you so long as you are outside my empire, but that can be arranged.
It is always unpleasant to remove a blemish, but unless you fade away on your own we will have to deal with the problem ourselves.
You endanger our investments, you destabilize the market, and you interfere in family business. Watch your back, bub, or you'll find a knife in it!
You endanger Unfallen space with your aggression. You would do well to not make us march to war.
There is still time for you to repent, though I doubt you will take the offer.
Most things in this universe cause us a sense of disquiet, but you may actually drive us to action.
My kin and I find you faithless and dangerous; you are like Necrophages, but with fancier guns.
Your people are a growing threat to us. If you seek an honorable death, continue as you are and we will gladly oblige.
Creature, you are a discordant note in a galaxy striving for harmony. Do not make us correct it.
Such arrogance as yours would've been dealt with swiftly in our time, so I suggest you show courteous thanks for this opportunity to make right.
Ah, shucks. You’re making me forget the first hundred primes. Anyway, we appreciate you digging us.
jttt--cfffzzz--tnjk . . . BLUNT: The Hive cares little for your praise.
Keep your actions as honeyed as your words and we will have no problems.
Why thank you. It is refreshing to see another being with a touch of good taste in this grim galaxy.
The Families recognize your kind words.
The Unfallen are pleased that you share our vision for the galaxy.
I thank you, but remind you I am but an instrument of the Virtual.
I must confess, this culture of sycophancy baffles the Riftborn. Your flattery falls on deaf ears. The most important thing is for a being to know its true nature.
I am generally suspicious of diplomatic compliments, but your words are greatly appreciated.
Your message is agreeable; I accept it for my nation and the Sun god.
Creature, your kind words resonate within the Choir.
Flattery is always welcome with the Nakalim, but don't think it will sway us.
The Sophonity just wanted to say . . . we like your style. Respect.
jkkt--ncccxx--wssst . . . BRIEF: You haven't shamed yourself recently. Well done.
The Empire salutes fellow patriots. Exaltations.
You may not see this as a compliment but it is: You have the most lovely DNA.
The Families send compliments.
The Unfallen praise you as fellow travelers toward a more harmonious future.
Blessings from the Holy Church of the Virtual. You minister well.
The Riftborn find most things in this universe intolerable. Not you though. We tolerate you.
The Aurigan Federacy salutes those who share our ideals of knowledge and independence.
We see in you the courage and honor we see in ourselves.
Creature, your strivings for harmony are an inspiration to the Umbral Choir. We salute you.
Her Majesty sends her compliments. You lead wisely.
Yeah, well, we don't like you either! We'll be fine though, after all we've still got time to research countermeasures! (Hekli, go tell Krez down in accounting we're gonna need a LOT more funding...)
KSHHHH--CLK . . . A bad move. Now we prepare. The rationing policies will only make us more dangerous.
I will use this time to prepare your civilization a fitting memorial. Maybe a ship, in memory of your honorable warning to us. Yes... Yes, I think I'd like that.
Wonderful! I'm glad someone in this galaxy has the class to let everyone get in position. Our glorious defense will make an excellent arc for my next biopic series.

Y'know I gotta thank you, war isn't fun but I haven't seen the Families shut up and band together like this in a while. Tell me when you get the gift basket, alright? You just earned me a lot of favors.
While there is something to be said for short wars being best, surrender would still not be ideal. We will take this time to prepare, and hope you change your mind.
Your hubris will be the subject of liturgical plays millennia from now. Your skies will burn gold with the essence of your people, and your words of regret will be quoted forever!
Your assistance is appreciated. Your declaration has simplified many ongoing debates about the future, and helped narrow down our choices to a single timeline.

We have spent our entire history weathering the storm. When you arrive, you'll see your preparations were a waste; only sealed holds and entire continents of partisans will await you. Assuming you even make landfall.
We are glad to find a kindred soul in this universe. We accept your challenge, and will whet our blades for the chosen date. It will be bittersweet to defeat such a rare opponent as you.
The Choir is surprised that you would reveal your plans deliberately. You will strike only shadows and echoes, now.
We've been waiting to take back our land since before you were born, but the thought is appreciated. I'll have my shipwrights roused from their dormancy at once.
We warned you! But did you listen!? Nooo, cause you're too SMART for Sophons! We'll see just how smart you are soon!
ZZZT--KSH . . . Our hunger swells. The hive stirs for war. Your panic is appreciated.
I hate waiting like this, don't you? It will be a little while before the Sheredyn have... "convinced" my remaining dukes to favor war, but I assure you your time is coming.
Beauty takes a lot of preparation, and I want this war to be beautiful for my history books. I'm sending you my best speeches for inspiration, so don't embarrass me when you go in front of the press.
I can't believe this is still a thing... Anyway, "we, the undersigned, hereby demand satisfaction from you, by blood and--" Okay look, we're coming for you, okay? Ridiculous tradition.
It is difficult to share this news, but sentiment among the Unfallen has turned towards war. We will send a preliminary agreement for coordinating civilian safety and prisoner treatment soon.
Normally we would announce ourselves on arrival, but I must force the clergy's hand. There will be war, and now neither of us have a choice in the matter.
While we are often displeased with this universe, we find that you are both an annoyance and a threat. We will feel safer once you have been dealt with.

Infighting and bickering are truly the greatest cultural strength and military weakness of my people. As First of the Bloodline, I must make executive decisions when necessary - the Vaulters march to war.
In accordance with ancient tradition, we seek war for glory and for sacrifice. Prepare your fleets so that we might take only the most brave and worthy captives for Tonatsi.
Can you hear that? That silence, the sound of safety and normality. It is a planned sound, a short rest before your compromised networks sing to herald our fleets. It will be a short song.

There was a garden once, where I walked as a girl, watching the Dust glitter in the early morning. It was somewhere on one of your worlds. I hope we don't accidentally damage it, unless you've already done so in your ignorance.

Can use Influence to buyout star system Improvements, research technologies and purchase resources on the marketplace.
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 1x [explorer] Faction Pact: +1% [prestigeColored] per [turn] (Max: 30%)

Use [lifeforceColored], a unique resource, to generate population and create Arks. Arks are used to colonize and develop systems, and can be moved at any time.
Starting Ships: 1x [vampirilis], 2x [lifeforce], 1x [explorer] Faction Pact: +1% Hero XP Gain per [turn] (Max: 30%)

Possesses a hidden Home System, located on a special node, that can be migrated to another special node for a cost. Cannot colonize Systems in the normal fashion, but is able to place hidden Sanctuaries on planets. Can abduct Sleeper agents from enemy populations to bring them back to the Home System as enhanced populations. Umbral Choir are immune to influence conversion; however their ships can be attacked in Cold War even when on their Home System. Umbral Choir are also immune to any negative effects of Special Nodes, and get a bonus depending on the type of special node their home system is current in. #C48594#Umbral Choir are not immune to Neutron Star cloaking disruption and Black Hole retreat prevention. However, they are immune to Neutron Star cloaking disruption if they have their home system on it.#REVERT#
Starting Ships: 2x [explorer] Faction Pact: +1% [processingPower] and +1 [hackingSpeed] per [turn] (Max: 30% and 30 respectively)

Use [dustColored] to colonize instead of colonizers Can negotiate/trade outposts using diplomacy No automatic shipment of food to outposts Can colonize through blockades Can use [prestigeColored] to boost outpost food production Starts with the ability to buyout construction, with a 15% [dustColored] discount
Starting Ships: 2x [explorer] Faction Pact: +1% [dustColored] per [turn] (Max: 30%)

Enslave factions living on the same planet -5 [happinessColored] per Enslaved Population +100% [fidsi] from Enslaved Population
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 2x [explorer] Faction Pact: -0.5% Ship [industryColored] Cost per [turn] (Max: -15%)
Transmigration Beacon
Umbral Choir Ship

An AI that allows you to play freely. Human Players get: • +2 [fidsi] per [population] • +20 [happinessColored] on Systems • +2 Overcolonization Threshold • -20% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -20% [dustColored] upkeep • +10% [hackingSpeed] • +40 [processingPower]

It's like you have guns, and they have sticks. Human Players get: • +1 [fidsi] per [population] • +10 [happinessColored] on Systems • +1 Overcolonization Threshold • -10% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -10% [dustColored] upkeep • +5% [hackingSpeed] • +20 [processingPower]
It’s like you have guns, and they have guns. Neither the AI nor Human players get any bonuses.

It’s like you have guns, and they have better guns. AI Players get: • +1 [fidsi] and +1 an additional [prestigeColored] per [population] • +20 [happinessColored] on Systems • -10% Overcolonization [happinessColored] penalties • -10% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -10% [dustColored] upkeep • +1 Maximum Behemoth • +10 [processingPower] • -50% Treaty [prestigeColored] upkeep • +1.5 Strategic Deposit Value • +7 Siege Power per [commandPoint] on Fleets • +1% Unfallen Vining Rate per Vine Module

It’s like you have guns, and they have tanks. AI Players get: • +2 [fidsi] and an additional +1.5 [prestigeColored] per [population] • +20 [happinessColored] on Systems • -20% Overcolonization [happinessColored] penalties • -20% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -20% [dustColored] upkeep • +2 Maximum Behemoths • +20 [processingPower] • -50% Treaty [prestigeColored] upkeep • +2 Strategic Deposit Value • +8 Siege Power per [commandPoint] on Fleets • +2% Unfallen Vining Rate per Vine Module

It’s like you have guns, and they have nuclear weapons systems that can track your biometrics. AI Players get: • +3 [fidsi] and an additional +1.5 [prestigeColored] per [population] • +40 [happinessColored] on Systems • -40% Overcolonization [happinessColored] penalties • -40% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -40% [dustColored] upkeep • +3 Maximum Behemoths • +30 [processingPower] • -50% Treaty [prestigeColored] upkeep • +2.5 Strategic Deposit Value • +9 Siege Power per [commandPoint] on Fleets • +3% Unfallen Vining Rate per Vine Module
Total Collection Bonus Tiers
Draft during Ground Battles Provides 1.5x Manpower
Draft during Ground Battles Provides 2x Manpower
in Neutral Territory
in Your Territory
in Friendly Territory
in Enemy Territory
Due to technical and operational collaboration, technology of friendly foreign empires can be integrated into this faction's military framework.
Due to technical and operational collaboration, technology of friendly foreign empires can be integrated into this faction's military framework.
Mercenary Contracting

Having a powerful army is a must if you wish to stand out on the galactic stage, but producing them yourself when you could be erecting large Obelisks is wasteful. By contracting mercenaries instead, this problem is entirely avoided.
Allows the research and construction of Mercenary Ships
Systems which only have Riftborn affinity populations don't have System Growth.
Enables conversion of 25% of excess [foodColored] into [dustColored]
Enables conversion of 25% of excess [foodColored] into [manpower]
+10 [happinessColored] on systems generating excess [foodColored]
Premium MREs
By providing additional calories and other dietary supplements in standard-issue rations, troops are consistently in peak condition, resulting in a greater number of combat-ready soldiers.
Fat and Happy
Who doesn't like a bit of extra food? By ensuring that agricultural excess is distributed amongst the populace, citizens become more enthused with their living conditions.
Allow Tech Trading
Controls whether factions are allowed to trade techs with each other. Enable this setting to allow technology trading.
True
Factions will be allowed to trade technologies with each other once they research the appropriate technology.
False
Factions will not be allowed to trade technologies with each other.
Allow Academy Expansion
Controls whether the Academy is allowed to produce colonizer fleets and claim systems.
True
The Academy will be allowed to colonize systems without donations from the Nakalim.
False
The Academy will be allowed to colonize systems without donations from the Nakalim.
Enable Diplomacy Rework
Determines whether the ESG Diplomacy rework will be enabled. If enabled, there will be new diplomatic proposals, but diplomacy [prestigeColored] Costs will be roughly twice as expensive.
True
You will use ESG diplomacy. There will be new diplomatic proposals, and diplomatic [prestigeColored] Costs will be roughly twice as expensive.
False
You will use Vanilla diplomacy. No additional diplomatic proposals and standard diplomatic [prestigeColored] Costs.
Beautified Architecture
By building structures to highly particular architectural specifications, the galaxy is made far more beautiful...and expensive

Refill movement points after the battle; use this tactic to be able to travel after the battle.
Movement points refilled after battle on Ships
Framework for the Glorification of Model Workers

Through this legislation, the triumphs of the working population (real and ficticious) are broadcast widely to all citizens, encouraging competition regarding how much devotion and effort they can publicly display for the empire. Productivity skyrockets as a result, though at the cost of a few disappearences among those who publicly question the veracity of official success stories.
We Can Do It!
+1% [FIDS] for each [happinessColored] above 100 (up to 20%)
Supreme Display Decree

The logistical and administrative framework required to field these behemoth-class ships puts a heavy strain on your empire's spaceports. By converting parts of these behemoths into museums dedicated to Hissho supremacy, your peoples are more willing to accept another titanic ship into the empire - and all the shipping delays it brings with it. Each behemoth becomes more expensive as a result however.
Red Blade Reforged
Appropriation of Enhanced Hazard Pay

For large scale weapon batteries, the extreme danger of reloading and maintaining nuclear payloads, fusion reactors and other advanced munitions can often cripple the speed at which they're able to be fired. Through this legislation, crews are given a large payout and life insurance in exchange for operating their weapon batteries beyond sane and safe levels. Rates of fire - and operating costs - increase dramatically empire wide on all navies.
Payouts 'n Payloads
Migration Immunity
Your empire has a reputation of being "good enough". No one particularly cares either way about immigration or emigration.
Population will not Migrate to or from your empire
